The UK government has recognized the challenges faced by first-time buyers in accessing affordable housing, particularly in areas with high demand such as Walsall. They have taken various steps to address this issue on a national level, including:

1. Increasing funding for affordable housing: The government has committed to investing billions of pounds in affordable housing schemes, including council housing, affordable rent, and shared ownership.

2. Reforming planning policies: The National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) has been revised to encourage housebuilding and streamline planning processes to allow for more affordable homes to be built.

3. Providing Stamp Duty relief: In 2017, the government introduced a permanent relief on Stamp Duty Land Tax for first-time buyers on properties worth up to £300,000, with partial relief available on properties worth up to £500,000.

4. Supporting local initiatives: The government also provides funding, via the Home Builders Fund, to support development initiatives and help to regenerate local areas. 

5. Launching Help to Buy Schemes: The government has introduced various Help to Buy Schemes that can provide financial aid to first-time buyers looking to purchase their own home.

While these measures may not guarantee a solution for first-time buyers in Walsall, they reflect efforts at the national level to improve access to affordable housing across the UK. However, there is still much work to be done to ensure that housing is affordable, accessible, and available to all.
